availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Webster County } SC

Whereas a vacancy exists in the office of presiding Judge of the County Court of Webster & whereas in the absence of of the County Court Clerk the law requires the Circuit Court Clerk to issue a writ of election Therefore I H H Smith circuit court clerk of the county of Webster issue this my writ of election to the Sheriff of Webster County who is hereby commanded to open a poll in each of the voting precincts in said county on saturday the 27th Inst for the purpose of electing a presiding Judge of the county court for the county aforesaid

Witness my hand this 15th day of December 1862
Copy attest H H Smith C W C C
William Harron to fill vacancy of Justice of Peace in 2d district Webster County

Webster Co
Pr. Judge & J. P.
Com Issd Jany 3 1863
